summary: Internal FBI email chain discussing a press conference held by the U.S. Attorney's Office (USAO) in front of Jeffrey Epstein's brownstone. FBI victim specialists (VS) express frustration that victims were not notified in advance, leading to feelings of anger and betrayal among victims.

events.title: USAO Press Conference at Epstein's Brownstone
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office held a press briefing in front of Jeffrey Epstein's brownstone. FBI victim specialists report that victims were not given advance notice, causing anger and feelings of betrayal.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office held a press conference at Jeffrey Epstein's brownstone on or before January 27, 2020.
FBI victim specialists were not notified in advance of the press conference.
Victims of Epstein learned about the press conference through news reports and expressed anger and feelings of betrayal.
The email chain reflects internal FBI communication attempting to address the breakdown in victim notification.
